terms.context: The employer's representative who confronts Gregor about his absence, business performance, and monetary accountability; calls out Gregor's voice as inhuman
terms.notes: 주임 (chief/senior) + 관리사 (manager/administrator) conveys hierarchical business authority. Alternative: 과장 (department head) - chose 주임 관리사 for more formal representation of employer's representative.

terms.context: The chief clerk's accusation that Gregor is isolating himself and refusing to communicate or perform duties
terms.notes: 자신을 갇히다 (confine oneself) captures the accusation of voluntary isolation and self-imprisonment that the clerk implies.

terms.context: Professional obligations and sales performance metrics; the clerk notes Gregor's turnover has been 'very unsatisfactory of late'
terms.notes: 업무 책임 (business duties/responsibilities) and 매출액 (sales turnover/revenue) - proper business Korean terminology that reflects early 20th century commercial context.

terms.source: money that was recently entrusted to you
terms.context: Suggests Gregor may have been handling client funds or company money; potential explanation the employer offered for his absence
terms.notes: 당신에게 맡겨진 돈 (money entrusted to you) emphasizes the trust and accountability dimension of the employer's suspicion. Preserves the formal accusatory tone.

terms.context: Gregor's reference to his regular commute time; he promises to catch this train to make it to the office, establishing temporal pressure
terms.notes: Direct translation with time precision. 기차 (train) is standard Korean. Specific times build mounting pressure throughout the narrative.

terms.context: The false medical explanation Gregor invents to justify his inability to appear and let the clerk in
terms.notes: 현기증 (dizziness) + 발작 (attack/fit) - creates medical-sounding excuse in Korean. Maintains the desperate, improvised nature of Gregor's lie.

terms.context: The chief clerk's observation that Gregor's speech is no longer human; the crucial moment of revelation that something is fundamentally wrong
terms.notes: 동물의 목소리 (voice of an animal) - simple, direct translation that preserves the shocking revelation. The contrast with human speech is thematically crucial.

terms.context: The father summons a locksmith (via the kitchen maid Anna) to force entry into Gregor's locked room
terms.notes: 자물쇠 (lock) + 수리공 (repairman/tradesperson) - standard Korean term for locksmith. Conveys both the mechanical skill and working-class status of the tradesperson.
